title: After Town Hall by Swarm
description: タウンホールには、カルダノのエコシステムに深く関わる参加者が参加します。彼らは、ディスカッションやネットワーキングのためのモデレートされたスペースを必要としています。

f6_assessments.q0: The Swarm has been essential in growing the community  and impacting the ecosystem positively - this proposal is no exception.
f6_assessments.q1: Of course - it's the Swarm! The proposing team has the relevant experience. The detailed plan is implementable and will be successful. The budged is reasonable and understandable.
f6_assessments.q2: The Swarm operates in the open and answers to the greater community. The KPIs make sense and are easy to audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
Swarm is already well-known group inside the Catalyst ecosystem. All latest aftertownhalls are followed by their networking groups. They might be fun and useful, but often rooms have few people, and we don't see the growth of aftertownhall participants. So maybe there are better ways to engage the community and bring more people to the Catalyst?  
Therefore I neither agree not disagree, and advise the voters to check all proposals and make your decision.
f6_assessments.q1: I neither agree not disagree because I don't see correlation between Swarm sessions and encourage entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano ecosystem to submit proposals to Catalyst in the next two funds. Also the budgeting could have more details.
f6_assessments.q2: It seems there is no correlation between growing Swarm and encouraging entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano ecosystem to submit proposals to Catalyst in the next two funds. Therefore it will be hard to audit the progress. People attend aftertownhalls as they don't have alternative.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal addresses the challenge in a rather clever way. The challenge is to find a way to acquire a certain type of user, in this case entrepreneurs who can join the community as proposers.
Since people watching town hall are more likely to be entrepreneurs, following up with them may retain some of them on the platform where they can be educated further.
As a digital marketer for more than 10 years, I can see the value of following up with users.
After town hall is a good idea and clever way for adding more proposers to the community.
f6_assessments.q1:
According to the details provided in this proposal, these ideas can be implemented successfully. If the team members who host and moderate the rooms are knowledgeable and prepared accordingly, I can visualize good success. 
My only advice is to find a way to track everything in order to be able to measure progress.
f6_assessments.q2:
Since the After town hall will take place on a weekly basis, and they give us clear goals, I think that the project is easily auditable.
For instance, every week the project members can share their stats with the community. We can see if the goal of 80% user retention will be achieved. Also they should find a way to measure how the user retention translates into new proposers.

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?
The initial statement does not show a problem as such.But in the detailed description the problem is laid out. Namely significant numbers are unaware or underestimating the possibilities of Cardano. 

Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
Yes it does.

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
Yes I feel it will add value to have breakout rooms after Town Hall. 

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
How the number of 812$ was arrived at, has not been stated.

Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
Yes they do fall within the scope. 

Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
Yes this can easily be replicated to forming other Town halls in other languages, time zones etc. This seems to cater to a European time zone, but South Asian, East Asian , Australasian time zones can have their own Town halls using this model.
f6_assessments.q1:
2. FEASIBILITY

Has the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
I have seen them host a Town Hall meeting.  Skills of hosting meetings are evident.

Are these links sufficient?
There are no links given. But the people are present here, and as i have seen at a TH meeting are highly engaged in hosting.


Have you the CA visited these links and contacted the relevant people?
I have interacted with the mentioned people. 

Have you been able to assess their level of competence?
They are quite competent.

Does proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
The team is established. Why there are that many numbers in the team is not clear, since many roles seem to be duplicated.

Has he rationally and logically laid out his team structure and breakdown?
Team structure is laid out. Some roles are duplicated.


Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
Budget has not been broken down. One figure is given and its said what its for but not what each activity costs.


IS budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
Budget is reasonable to achieve goals.


Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
There is no other plan if additional funding is required.

Have you verified this plan?
No

Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
There is no timetable laid out.

Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
It shows whats being done and how its being done.

Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
Yes. 

Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
Yes

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
There appear to be no risks for success. Nonetheless none have been mentioned.

Since the townhalls have been happening successfully, its clear the participants can carry these out.  The budget has no break down so I cannot comment on whether its too high or too low. If all the members are required, then its not a high value.
f6_assessments.q2:
3) Auditability

Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
There is a clear roadmap laid out.

Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
Specific metrics and KPIs are laid out. These include number of breakout rooms, retention rate of participants, participation and engagement of viewers is to be tracked.

Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
The problem is addressed but the solution appears to be stated as engaging them by holding the ATH sessions.

Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
Yes, carrying out the ATH sessions to disseminate knowledge and create interactivity in the event, and between participants. 

Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
None 
How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
None are mentioned

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
No contingency plans.

f6_assessments.q0: it is definitely a good idea, to have after-sessions for newcomers, to provide a free space for chat and to explain questions. It can lead to an increased number of community members - not only proposers - which is another added value.
f6_assessments.q1: relevant experience provided, git repository inspected, altough the website is running on outdated or not-safe certificate (sorry for the language, non-IT guy here)
f6_assessments.q2: transparent git, possibly numbers of participants from session to session to monitor the success.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe this is a great idea and holds to the spirit of great initiative that is working well for the community and is setting what it was intentionally there to achieve for the Cardano hovernment framework. I think getting some compensation for the great work that happens in those session and the social development that comes from it.
f6_assessments.q1: Ive seen some of the sessions and they are a very innovative way of reaching the community, share information and host different opinions in matters related to the governance side of it. I think is quite proven so building on top of this is nothing but a compliment to the already great work happening. Reaching to other ecosystems is a great approach.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the information provided is quite extensive and well documented and the yourube videos are a great way to welcome new voices to the space that may lead to growth in both community, partnerships and deployments.

solution: 毎週行われるタウンホールの後に、時事問題について話し合うための休憩室を設ける。資金提供されたプロジェクトや今後のプロジェクト、アイデアのためのスペースを提供する。
experience: これまでに13以上のAfter Town Hallセッションを開催し、CA、vCA、2人のCatalyst Circleメンバーが参加しました。
